in the approved buyer's address","_ticketId":"takes in the ticket ID of the ticket"}},"circuitBreaker()":{"return":"returns contractPaused as true or false depending on whether the circuit breaker is on or off"},"createAccount(string,string)":{"params":{"_firstName":"takes user first name","_lastName":"takes user last name"},"return":"returns the user ID"},"createTicket(string,string,uint256)":{"params":{"_description":"takes ticket description","_eventName":"takes event name","_price":"takes ticket price"}},"priceRevise(uint256,uint256)":{"params":{"_newPrice":"takes in the new price of the ticket","_ticketId":"takes in the ticket ID of the ticket"},"return":"returns the new price of the ticket"},"transferEthSecond(uint256)":{"params":{"_ticketId":"takes in the ticket ID of the ticket"}},"transferEthToCD(uint256)":{"params":{"_ticketId":"takes in the ticket ID of the ticket"}},"transferFrom(address,address,uint256)":{"params":{"_from":"takes in the seller (i.e. contract deployer) address","_ticketId":"takes in the ticket ID of the ticket","_to":"takes in the buyer address"}},"transferFromSecond(address,uint256)":{"params":{"_ticketId":"takes in the ticket ID of the ticket","_to":"takes in the buyer's address"}}},"title":"TicketTransfer contract"},"userdoc":{"methods":{"approve(address,uint256)":{"notice":"when user clicks on 'Approve', this function approves the user as a buyer of the ticket in the secondary marketfunction requires the buyer to have an account and have sufficient funds to pay for the ticketthe funds paid by the buyer gets stored in a mapping which maps the ticket ID to the amount paid, this amount is later released to the sellerthe ticket's secondary market status becomes 1 i.e. approvedByBuyer after approval takes place"},"circuitBreaker()":{"notice":"circuit breaker function can only be called by contract deployer, when circuit breaker is on, any functions with this modifier will not go throughpurpose of circuit breaker is to put a pause on smart contracts in case of an attack by a malicious party"},"constructor":"defines the amount of commission the contract deployer will take from ticket sales in the secondary market (e.g. 30 means 1/30 ~ 3.3%)","createAccount(string,string)":{"notice":"function handles account creation by users who want to use the Dapp to purchase/resell tickets, user info is appended into the users array"},"createTicket(string,string,uint256)":{"notice":"function can only be called by contract deployer, handles ticket creationnew tickets are appended to the tickets array, and two relevant mappings are also updatedfunction emits an event whenever a new ticket is created"},"getApprovedBuyer(uint256)":{"notice":"simple getter function"},"getContractDeployer()":{"notice":"below functions are simple getter functions for various variables and mappings"},"kill()":{"notice":"as this is a test Dapp, this function allows the contract deployer to remove the contract after testing"},"priceRevise(uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"function allows the ticket owner only to change the price of the ticket"},"transferEthSecond(uint256)":{"notice":"similar to the 'transferEthToCD' function, this function is called automatically after 'transferFromSecond' goes throughfunction requires the msg.sender to be the seller of the ticket (i.e. the 'previous' owner, retrieved from the 'ticketIdToOldOwner' mapping)funds are released to seller and the contract deployer (commission) using the 'ticketIdToPending' mapping which keeps track of the amount paid by buyertwo mappings can be deleted after transfer is done as they are no longer needed in storage (can save gas)the ticket's secondary market status becomes 3 i.e. DoneDeal"},"transferEthToCD(uint256)":{"notice":"function is called automatically after the above 'transferFrom' goes through, funds are transferred to contract deployer from the contract"},"transferFrom(address,address,uint256)":{"notice":"when buyer clicks on 'Purchase', this function is called to handle the transfer of ticket ownership from contract deployer to buyerfunction requires the buyer to have an account and have sufficient funds to pay for the ticketrelevant mappings are updated as a result of the ticket ownership transfer and a transfer event is emitted"},"transferFromSecond(address,uint256)":{"notice":"when seller clicks on 'Sell', this function handles the transfer of ticket ownership from the seller to the approved buyer in the secondary marketthe functionalities are similar to the 'transferFrom' function, only main difference is that this deals with transfers in the secondary marketthe ticket's secondary market status becomes 2 i.e. ownershipTransferred after transfer takes placeafter transfer, the approvedBuyer mapping for the ticket gets deleted as it is no longer needed in storage (can save gas)"}},"notice":"this contract mainly deals with ticket transfers as well as fund transfers in the primary and secondary markets"}},"settings":{"compilationTarget":{"/Users/AaronKo/Desktop/Solidity/ConsensysProjectLocalServer/contracts/TicketTransfer.sol":"TicketTransfer"},"evmVersion":"petersburg","libraries":{},"optimizer":{"enabled":false,"runs":200},"remappings":[]},"sources":{"/Users/AaronKo/Desktop/Solidity/ConsensysProjectLocalServer/contracts/TicketCreation.sol":{"keccak256":"0x856ca83adfb01bdfdeea09caf02e95d83a7fbfd7fc2583a5a3ce820ff8755899","urls":["bzzr://50fe431b28898ce0208b1b86c512a625430f0e31f98811a9cffb9e35e125fa0f"]},"/Users/AaronKo/Desktop/Solidity/ConsensysProjectLocalServer/contracts/TicketTransfer.sol":{"keccak256":"0x34f7b3b361ae7fc861dd0f2098e8e33583b978d28f85b79212cbc4a1d88d87af","urls":["bzzr://39b0dfd461308ae3ab1843ceacc3e48bf257a83158b12fbbe7209588a918b300"]},"/Users/AaronKo/Desktop/Solidity/ConsensysProjectLocalServer/contracts/erc721.sol":{"keccak256":"0x3e67f94d1d7a5666f5151381f58ab364f2f752017d7a264e7b558acdb01a553a","urls":["bzzr://2a0657f618d3755eafd2b7c9caf7d541f4b4bf7a9db9bb91b29dbf2891f04868"]},"/Users/AaronKo/Desktop/Solidity/ConsensysProjectLocalServer/contracts/safemath.sol":{"keccak256":"0xb27d5311e8d0902323e3f63b87b956f6d2f3aa71226d37f560603967da9c793a","urls":["bzzr://d9c148230172f5e33fd01e3f259d1d460be4ae90e41064567942f05ccf421cb6"]}},"version":1}

nodes.documentation:
@title TicketTransfer contract
 @notice this contract mainly deals with ticket transfers as well as fund transfers in the primary and secondary markets
nodes.name: TicketTransfer

nodes.documentation: @notice defines the amount of commission the contract deployer will take from ticket sales in the secondary market (e.g. 30 means 1/30 ~ 3.3%)
@notice creates (1) an event whenever a transfer of ticket ownership occurs; and (2) an event whenever a buyer approves him/herself as the buyer of a ticket in the secondary market
nodes.name: Transfer

nodes.documentation: @notice modifier disallows the seller making the function call (e.g. a seller should not be able to force a user to approve him/herself as buyer of the ticket)
nodes.name: notSeller

nodes.documentation: @notice modifier disallows the contract deployer making the function call (e.g. contract deployer cannot force-sell its tickets to any users)
nodes.name: notContractDeployer

nodes.documentation: @notice modifier requires the function to be called by the ticket owner
nodes.name: ownsTicket

nodes.documentation: @notice below functions are simple getter functions for various variables and mappings
nodes.name: getContractDeployer

typeDescriptions.typeString: struct TicketCreation.Ticket storage ref[] storage ref

 @param _ticketId takes in the ticket ID of the ticket

nodes.documentation:
@title TicketTransfer contract
 @notice this contract mainly deals with ticket transfers as well as fund transfers in the primary and secondary markets
nodes.name: TicketTransfer

nodes.documentation: @notice defines the amount of commission the contract deployer will take from ticket sales in the secondary market (e.g. 30 means 1/30 ~ 3.3%)
@notice creates (1) an event whenever a transfer of ticket ownership occurs; and (2) an event whenever a buyer approves him/herself as the buyer of a ticket in the secondary market
nodes.name: Transfer

nodes.documentation: @notice modifier disallows the seller making the function call (e.g. a seller should not be able to force a user to approve him/herself as buyer of the ticket)
nodes.name: notSeller

nodes.documentation: @notice modifier disallows the contract deployer making the function call (e.g. contract deployer cannot force-sell its tickets to any users)
nodes.name: notContractDeployer

nodes.documentation: @notice modifier requires the function to be called by the ticket owner
nodes.name: ownsTicket

nodes.documentation: @notice below functions are simple getter functions for various variables and mappings
nodes.name: getContractDeployer

 @param _ticketId takes in the ticket ID of the ticket

nodes.documentation: @notice as this is a test Dapp, this function allows the contract deployer to remove the contract after testing
nodes.name: kill

params._approved: takes in the approved buyer's address
params._ticketId: takes in the ticket ID of the ticket

circuitBreaker().return: returns contractPaused as true or false depending on whether the circuit breaker is on or off

params._newPrice: takes in the new price of the ticket
params._ticketId: takes in the ticket ID of the ticket

priceRevise(uint256,uint256).return: returns the new price of the ticket

params._ticketId: takes in the ticket ID of the ticket
takes in the ticket ID of the ticket

params._from: takes in the seller (i.e. contract deployer) address
params._ticketId: takes in the ticket ID of the ticket
takes in the ticket ID of the ticket

approve(address,uint256).notice: when user clicks on 'Approve', this function approves the user as a buyer of the ticket in the secondary marketfunction requires the buyer to have an account and have sufficient funds to pay for the ticketthe funds paid by the buyer gets stored in a mapping which maps the ticket ID to the amount paid, this amount is later released to the sellerthe ticket's secondary market status becomes 1 i.e. approvedByBuyer after approval takes place

circuitBreaker().notice: circuit breaker function can only be called by contract deployer, when circuit breaker is on, any functions with this modifier will not go throughpurpose of circuit breaker is to put a pause on smart contracts in case of an attack by a malicious party

methods.constructor: defines the amount of commission the contract deployer will take from ticket sales in the secondary market (e.g. 30 means 1/30 ~ 3.3%)

createAccount(string,string).notice: function handles account creation by users who want to use the Dapp to purchase/resell tickets, user info is appended into the users array

createTicket(string,string,uint256).notice: function can only be called by contract deployer, handles ticket creationnew tickets are appended to the tickets array, and two relevant mappings are also updatedfunction emits an event whenever a new ticket is created

getContractDeployer().notice: below functions are simple getter functions for various variables and mappings

kill().notice: as this is a test Dapp, this function allows the contract deployer to remove the contract after testing

priceRevise(uint256,uint256).notice: function allows the ticket owner only to change the price of the ticket

transferEthSecond(uint256).notice: similar to the 'transferEthToCD' function, this function is called automatically after 'transferFromSecond' goes throughfunction requires the msg.sender to be the seller of the ticket (i.e. the 'previous' owner, retrieved from the 'ticketIdToOldOwner' mapping)funds are released to seller and the contract deployer (commission) using the 'ticketIdToPending' mapping which keeps track of the amount paid by buyertwo mappings can be deleted after transfer is done as they are no longer needed in storage (can save gas)the ticket's secondary market status becomes 3 i.e. DoneDeal

transferEthToCD(uint256).notice: function is called automatically after the above 'transferFrom' goes through, funds are transferred to contract deployer from the contract

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).notice: when buyer clicks on 'Purchase', this function is called to handle the transfer of ticket ownership from contract deployer to buyerfunction requires the buyer to have an account and have sufficient funds to pay for the ticketrelevant mappings are updated as a result of the ticket ownership transfer and a transfer event is emitted

transferFromSecond(address,uint256).notice: when seller clicks on 'Sell', this function handles the transfer of ticket ownership from the seller to the approved buyer in the secondary marketthe functionalities are similar to the 'transferFrom' function, only main difference is that this deals with transfers in the secondary marketthe ticket's secondary market status becomes 2 i.e. ownershipTransferred after transfer takes placeafter transfer, the approvedBuyer mapping for the ticket gets deleted as it is no longer needed in storage (can save gas)

userdoc.notice: this contract mainly deals with ticket transfers as well as fund transfers in the primary and secondary markets
